art.capt: feather 1a: A: 1 quill, 2 vane; B: 1 barb, 2 barbule, 3 barbicel with hamulus

entry.et: Middle English fether, from Old English; akin to Old High German federa wing, Latin petere to go to, seek, Greek petesthai to fly, piptein to fall, pteron wing

def.dt: :any of the light horny epidermal outgrowths that form the external covering of the body of birds and that consist of a shaft bearing on each side a series of barbs which bear barbules which in turn bear barbicels commonly ending in hooked hamuli and interlocking with the barbules of an adjacent barb to link the barbs into a continuous vane
:plume 2a
:the vane of an arrow
:plumage
:kind nature birds of a feather flock together
:attire dress
:condition mood woke up in fine feather
:composure some feathers had been ruffled D. J. Blum
:feathering 2
:a projecting strip, rib, fin, or flange
:a feathery flaw in the eye or in a precious stone
:the act of feathering an oar
:a mark of distinction :honor

art.cap: feather 1a: A: 1 quill, 2 vane; B: 1 barb, 2 barbule, 3 barbicel with hamulus

def.dt: :to furnish (as an arrow) with a feather
:to cover, clothe, or adorn with or as if with feathers
:to turn (an oar blade) almost horizontal when lifting from the water at the end of a stroke to reduce air resistance
:to change the angle of (airplane propeller blades) so that the chords become approximately parallel to the line of flight
:to change the angle of airplane propeller blades of (an engine) in such a manner
:to change the angle of (a rotor blade of a rotorcraft) periodically in forward flight
:to reduce the edge of to a featheredge
:to cut (as air) with or as if with a wing
:to join by a tongue and groove
:to hit, throw, pass, or shoot softly and usually with precision feathered a perfect lob over the net
:to grow or form feathers
:to have or take on the appearance of a feather or something feathered
:to soak in and spread :blur used of ink or a printed impression
:to feather an oar or an airplane propeller blade
:to provide for oneself especially financially by unethically exploiting a position of trust
river 100 miles (161 kilometers) N cen California flowing S into Sacramento River
:a feather mattress
:a bed having a feather mattress
:any of an order (Comatulida) of free-swimming stalkless crinoids
:one of the medium-sized feathers that form the general covering of a bird and determine the external contour
:one of the quills of a bird's wing or tail that support it in flight compare contour feather
:a showy widely cultivated annual plant (Amaranthus hypochondriacus or A. cruentus) of the amaranth family having dense usually red spikes of flowers

entry.et: from the superstition that a white feather in the plumage of a gamecock is a mark of a poor fighter

def.dt: :a mark or symbol of cowardice used chiefly in the phrase show the white feather
:to cover with tar
:to defile as if with tar least tarred by the scandal Newsweek
:to smear (a person) with tar and cover with feathers as a punishment or indignity
:to mark or stain with the same fault or characteristic
